DataElement.preferredName: Patient Relapse Refractory Myeloma Measurable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to relapsed and refractory myeloma with measure disease as outlined in  the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Recurrent Disease Refractory Plasma Cell Myeloma Measurable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The return of a disease after a period of remission._Plasma cell myeloma that is resistant to treatment._A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Refractory Plasma Cell Myeloma Measurable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.:Plasma cell myeloma that is resistant to treatment.:A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
Multiple myeloma that is resistant to treatment.
A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have relapsed an
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have relapsed and/or refractory multiple myeloma with measurable disease defined as at least one of the following: serum monoclonal protein greater than or equal to 0.5 g/dL, urinary monoclonal protein excretion of greater than or equal to 200 mg/24 hours, or kappa or lambda light chain level greater than or equal to 10 mg/dL with an abnormal free light chain ratio?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have RRMM with measurable disease with at least one of the following: M-protein greater than or equal to 0.5 g/dL in serum or greater than or equal to 200 mg/24-hour in urine, or serum free light chain (FLC) greater than or equal to 10 mg/dL with abnormal serum FLC ratio for subjects without measurable disease by serum protein electrophoresis (SPEP) or urine protein electrophoresis (UPEP) criteria?
